title: What are the lessons that we can learn from the world wars about humanity? - Quora

response.answer_text: Humanity has never learnt since time immovable. Dislikes, hatred, violence has been running in the blood of human beings. I am not sure why we are called human beings… I read in a darker alley of Melbourne street, in front of a rehabilitation centre, “We are not human beings in search of spirituality, we are spiritual beings in search of humanity.” Humanity is lost since the birth of so called human beings. Being is to be. To be human is to love, be compassionate, kind, forgiving, benevolent, gracious, humble. Wars have the basis from greed to ego arising from having abundance to control. We have learnt nothing from the wars, accepting grief, loss, fear of all kinds, inhuman acts. We have learnt that human beings of different races can not function in harmony and peace, there is no concept of equality and equanimity, there is quick division of good and bad. Today, we fight a war with our generation to come and their very existence. Look how the climate change and global warming (both related) are going to inundate humanity from the face of the planet. If we want our grand children to suffer, let us continue procreation, else let us half the global warming. With love and peace
